etymology.description: semantic 禾 (“grain”) + phonetic 呈 (OC *rleŋ, *l'eŋs) — measurements.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the semantic cue 禾 to suggest agriculture and measuring grain or fields with the phonetic 呈 to signal the pronunciation chéng. The sense broadened from measuring agricultural quantities to standardized procedures, courses, and schedules.

parts.english: to present; to submit; to appear

examples.chinese: 我把明天的行程安排好了(我把明天的行程安排好了)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bǎ míngtiān de xíngchéng ānpái hǎo le.

examples.chinese: 新软件的安装程序很简单(新軟體的安裝程序很簡單)。
examples.pinyin: Xīn ruǎnjiàn de ānzhuāng chéngxù hěn jiǎndān.
examples.english: The installation procedure of the new software is very simple.

examples.chinese: 项目进程按预定的步骤进行(項目進程按預定的步驟進行)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàngmù jìnchéng àn yùdìng de bùzhòu jìnxíng.
examples.english: The project’s course proceeds according to the planned steps.
